The program is free upfront and our customers pay us back when they\u2019re hired.\n\nBuilt around aligned incentives, we help build equity in the job search process by providing 1-on-1 mentorship, training, and a platform to uplift job seekers and ultimately, help them fulfill their hopes, ambitions, and livelihoods. We\u2019ve already helped more than a thousand fellows land meaningful jobs, and helped them earn over $100M in salary.\n\nIn 2022 we raised our Series B and there is even more exciting growth on the horizon. That year we expanded from 6 to 14 industries, launched a tiered pricing system with differentiated product offerings, and much more.\n\nOur Mission \ud83d\ude80\nOur mission is to help people everywhere build their careers by being the world\u2019s best career agency. \n\nWe believe the job search system is broken and can be fixed with a business model that acts on behalf of the job seeker, instead of on behalf of employers, recruiters, or schools. If this sounds interesting to you, we look forward to hearing from you!\n\nRead more about our mission in our manifesto.\n\nThe Role\nThe Career Mentor team is the fastest growing team at Pathrise. Our curriculum was developed by ex-Google and Github recruiters. We are looking for mission-driven career educators to join our awesome team of Career Mentors.\n \nAs a Career Mentor, you will be responsible for fellows&#x27; success by helping our job seekers develop their soft skills and personal brand through a variety of workshops and 1-on-1 mentoring sessions. You will work cross-functionally with technical mentors, our product team, and operations to promote engagement, process improvements, and data tracking.\n\nMentors who thrive in this role embrace a data driven, metrics oriented approach to career coaching in a dynamic startup environment!\nResponsibilities\nAct as the main mentor for a caseload of fellows (often around 40, could be higher or lower as needed)\nResponsible for reaching fellow metrics (KPIs) such as retention, interview rate, placement speed, placement percentages, etc. through strategic initiatives\nProvide 1-on-1 support to job seekers to meet fellow placement and interview tracking metrics\nSupport fellows with various aspects of the hiring process including but not limited to resume writing, application strategies, behavioral mock interviewing, and negotiation.\nConduct regular check-ins with fellows to discuss their job search updates\nWork with fellows and other advisors to ensure good data collection to track progress\nQualifications\n2+ years of full-time experience in career coaching at a professional organization\nAbility to work in a metrics oriented environment (i.e. placement and interview metrics for your caseload, SLAs, etc)\nAbility to work with or quickly learn the following: Google Suite, Slack, Airtable, Salesforce, Notion, Asana, etc\nHigh administrative acumen with the ability to onboard up to 10 new fellows per week; you are that person who can manage 15 things at once and never miss a deadline - you are a zero-inbox junkie and love to cross things off your daily to-do list\nPut our fellows first by having a passion for our mission and working collaboratively to pinpoint fellow issues to help them land their dream job!\nFlexibility and a willingness to adapt to new situations - the job market is fluid and the hiring landscape is always changing! We are looking for individuals who can help our fellows navigate these changes by taking on new challenges in stride\nNice to Have\nRecruiting experience in the tech space is a plus!\nExperience supporting a designated caseload of 30+ clients, students, or fellows at a time\nCompensation &amp; Benefits\n\ud83d\udcb0$50,000 - 60,000/year base salary (SF Bay Area, NYC or Los Angeles residents: $55,000 - 65,000/year)\n\ud83d\ude4cAnnual commission of $10,000 - 20,000/year; when our fellows get placed - you get rewarded!\n\ud83e\ude99Meaningful equity in the form of stock options\n\u2708\ufe0fFully remote with annual company sponsored team-building trips to places like Lake Tahoe and Denver\n\u2695\ufe0fMedical, Dental &amp; Vision insurance coverage - we can provide plan details for specifics\n\ud83c\udf34Flexible Unlimited Time (FlexTime) Off Policy \n\u2764\ufe0f\u200d\ud83e\ude79Annual Professional Development &amp; Wellness Stipends\n\ud83e\uddd1\u200d\ud83d\udcbb50% computer reimbursement and $300 reimbursement cap for WFH office equipment\n$50,000 - $65,000 a year\nBase of $50,000 - 65,000\nCommission between $10,000 - $20,000 annually.\nTotal cash compensation (base + commission, not including performance bonuses) may range from $60,000 - 85,000 per year.\n\nCareer Mentors receive commission incentives for fellow placements and interviews, on top of their base salary. Total cash compensation including both base and commission typically falls between $60k - 85k per year. Commission is uncapped.\n\nPerformance bonuses and/or raises are evaluated annually for team members who meet the expectations for their role.\nOur culture\n\ud83d\udc4b We are a tight-knit community that champions for our staff to bring their authentic true selves to work and aim to provide a fun and collaborative work environment for everyone. Although we are remote we have many virtual and company sponsored in-person events. We also value diversity - our Career team is made up of mentors from a variety of different backgrounds and identities, and exemplifies what Pathrise stands for externally as well as internally. Read more about how we aim to create a diverse and inclusive environment: What DE&amp;I means to Pathrise \u2764\ufe0f\ud83e\udde1\ud83d\udc9b\ud83d\udda4\ud83e\udd0e\n\nOur interview process\n- Phone chat with a recruiter \n- HackerRank assessment - no coding involved. This hands-on evaluation looks at resume writing skills and strategic thinking. Think &quot;technical test&quot;, but for a career coach instead of an engineer.\n- Mock career coaching round\n- Final virtual &quot;onsite&quot;, which is a mixture of behavioral interview panels\n- Reference checks\n\nThis role is remote within the US only, and is not currently available to applicants located outside of the US. US work authorization is required.\n\n\ud83d\udca1The Pathrise Approach to Hiring\n\nAt Pathrise we have a unique understanding of the hiring process from the perspective of companies and candidates, and the ups and downs that come with it. Candidates are close to our hearts - we&#x27;ve been them, we coach them, we know them.\n\nOur general full-time hiring process outlined below. Note: this doesn&#x27;t apply to part-time roles which consist of an intro call + a 30-45 min final interview.\n\nApplication Stage\n- Our recruiting team reviews applications and responds to qualified applicants as quickly as possible.\n- Our ATS does not auto-reject in any way\n- Note that some part-time roles are listed in &quot;Inactive - Resume Pool&quot; status, meaning hiring happens on a rolling basis and may open unexpectedly.\n\nIntro Call\n- In this 30 minute phone call, we aim to align on the role and answer your questions to ensure a mutual fit\n- Taking the next step in your career is a big deal! Ask whatever questions you need to ensure we&#x27;re the right fit for you.\n- Candidates who advance will be provided with a helpful guide to support their candidate experience.\n\nSkill Assessment or Hiring Manager Interview\n- For some roles, this is a 30 minute Google Meet interview with a hiring manager.\n- For other roles, this stage is a hands-on skill assessment that gives you a firsthand glimpse of what basic skills are needed to execute in this role, and how they&#x27;ll be applied. It also gives us early signals on the more technical aspects of candidate fit.\n\nVirtual Onsite (full-time roles only)\n- Candidates will meet with hiring managers and collaborators for further skill assessments and behavioral interviews.\n- Because this stage can take considerable time for all candidates and interviewers (1.5 - 3 hours), we are very intentional about how we conduct it and who we move forward. We do our best to be mindful of time commitments and candidate efforts, and will communicate if things change unexpectedly.\n- You&#x27;ll receive guidance well in advance.\n\nReference Interviews (full-time roles only)\n- We&#x27;ll ask for some professional references to follow up with.\n\n\nPathrise is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that proudly pursues and hires a diverse workforce. Pathrise does not make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of race, color, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, sex, gender, gender-identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable local, state, or federal laws or prohibited by Company policy. Pathrise also strives for a healthy and safe workplace and strictly prohibits harassment of any kind. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and other similar state laws and local ordinances, and its internal policy, Pathrise will also consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.\n\nIf you are instead interested in our fellowship program, please submit an intake form and our Admissions team will follow up: https://www.pathrise.com/apply.\n"]}, Here&#x27;s a breakdown to consider:\n\n### Tabloid-sized (11&quot;x17&quot;) PDF Resume:\n- **Pros:**\n  - More space for creativity and to display your work, especially if your profession involves graphic design, architecture, or other visual arts.\n  - Can make a bold statement and stand out from other candidates.\n  - Suitable for including samples of your work directly on your resume if they&#x27;re visual.\n\n- **Cons:**\n  - Not the standard size, so it might not be as easily accepted by all hiring systems or managers.\n  - Could be viewed as impractical or too unconventional for some industries.\n  - Harder to print and handle for the employer, which might be an inconvenience.\n\n### Standard Letter-sized (8.5&quot;x11&quot;) PDF Resume:\n- **Pros:**\n  - Widely accepted and expected size for resumes in most professional fields.\n  - Easier for hiring managers to print, file, and handle.\n  - More likely to be compatible with applicant tracking systems (ATS) that many companies use.\n\n- **Cons:**\n  - Less space for creative layouts and visual elements.\n  - Might blend in with other resumes if not well-designed.\n\n### Decision Factors:\n1. **Industry Norms:** If you&#x27;re applying for a role in a creative field, the tabloid size could showcase your design skills and originality effectively. For more traditional fields, stick with the letter size.\n   \n2. **Content vs. Design:** Consider whether the additional space in the tabloid size genuinely enhances the presentation of your qualifications or if it&#x27;s just for aesthetics. The letter size may be sufficient if your resume is content-heavy without the need for large visual elements.\n\n3. **Practicality and Accessibility:** Remember that your resume should be easily accessible and readable by the employer. If the larger size complicates these factors, it might not be the best choice.\n\nGiven your career as a Career Mentor, which likely emphasizes content over extensive design elements, a standard letter-sized resume might be more appropriate and universally accepted, ensuring it can be easily handled and reviewed by any prospective employer. However, if you&#x27;re applying to a role that values innovation and uniqueness highly, and you believe the tabloid-sized resume significantly adds to your presentation, it could be worth using for those specific applications."]}, "status": "finished_successfully", "end_turn": true, "weight": 1.0, "metadata": {"finish_details": {"type": "stop", "stop_tokens": [100260]}, "citations": [], "gizmo_id": null, "is_complete": true, "message_type": null, "model_slug": "gpt-4", "parent_id": "c059dba1-91ed-45fb-bdc1-107dee30adc5", "request_id": "86072320fdb677fa-FCO", "timestamp_": "absolute"}, "recipient": "all", "channel": null}, "parent": "c059dba1-91ed-45fb-bdc1-107dee30adc5", "children": ["aaa2c36a-0f78-4725-ac8c-cb92bd73d809"]}, "aaa2c36a-0f78-4725-ac8c-cb92bd73d809": {"id": "aaa2c36a-0f78-4725-ac8c-cb92bd73d809", "message": {"id": "aaa2c36a-0f78-4725-ac8c-cb92bd73d809", "author": {"role": "user", "name": null, "metadata": {}}, "create_time": 1709778662.747974, "update_time": null, "content": {"content_type": "text", "parts": ["Can you compose a short cover letter that talks about my fit for the position and mentions my other experience? We achieve this through our Coaching Enablement Platform, offering a comprehensive suite of services designed to support and accelerate coaches&#x27; development. Our services include the Coaching Center of Excellence (a hub for professional development and education), Coaching Management Software, and Coaching Marketplace. Through these platforms, we empower coaches to shape their skills and have a profound impact on human life.\n\nAs a Membership Coordinator at Coaching.com, you will play a vital role in managing and coordinating various aspects of our membership programs and community engagement initiatives. This role is ideal for a proactive, confident and detail-oriented individual who is passionate about supporting professional development and fostering a sense of community among our members.\n\nRESPONSIBILITIES\nThe Membership Coordinator reports directly to the Membership Manager &amp; Membership Director to support the delivery training and education to Coaching.com Members in the Coaching Center of Excellence. \n\nYour main responsibility is to support, coordinate and execute membership delivery tasks, ensuring agreed program milestones are met. The role also has a specific focus on managing volunteer facilitators, hosting and providing technical support on live sessions, and coordinating the monthly newsletter. \n\n1. Membership Project Management:\nSupport the Membership Manager &amp; Director in the development &amp; delivery of Membership features and services. \nSet up, manage and track Membership delivery project plans, its elements and activities\nBe responsible for the successful delivery of all tasks related to the Membership according to the established delivery project plans.\nSchedule meetings, prepare agendas, take notes and share follow-up action-steps with the involved internal stakeholders.\nImplement already established processes and/or workflows for the Membership as required.\n\n2. Membership Delivery:\nCollaborate with the Membership Team on delivery, design &amp; development processes.\nResolve Members\u2019 support requests on a day-to-day basis.\nCoordinate focus groups to gather insights and feedback from members, analyzing data and providing actionable recommendations.\nManage and coordinate volunteer facilitators, allocating sessions, being their point of contact and ensuring they are well-prepared for the sessions they are facilitating. \nCoordinate and curate content for newsletters, ensuring timely and relevant information is shared across teams.\nManage Salesforce emails for the Membership Team, including creating and scheduling email campaigns, tracking performance metrics, and optimizing communications.\nSupport the delivery of live membership sessions on Zoom, including session support, session hosting, logistical coordination, scheduling and content preparation.\nCreate and post content in Coaching.com\u2019s online community. Increase engagement through sharing valuable content and encouraging conversation with members. \nAssist with general administrative tasks related to membership management, including summit coordination, member database maintenance, and documentation.\n\nKEY COMPETENCIES\n\nYou\u2019re experienced:\nYou have a background in Digital Project/Program Management of at least 3 years, in a remote environment. \n\nYou&#x27;re a strong communicator:\nYou have excellent communication in English, spoken, heard, and written. Excellent interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to work with a wide range of external and internal customers and stakeholders from different countries and cultures, handling rapid development and change requests.\n\nYou&#x27;re organized:\nYou are data-driven, and very meticulous in your organization and approach with projects. You love structure! \n\nYou deliver results:\nYou are a dynamic self-starter. You are able to work independently, with your own initiative to achieve agreed aims and objectives and find creative solutions to problems. You love working with autonomy and don&#x27;t enjoy micro-management.\n\nYou&#x27;re adaptable and flexible:\nAbility to work in a fast-paced, high-intensity work environment. Able to proactively manage your own wellbeing and the challenges of maintaining communication and collaboration in a remote environment.\n\nYou\u2019re a confident and energized public speaker:\nYou are comfortable and confident in speaking to large audiences on live online sessions, facilitator meetings and team meetings. Your speaking style is clear, composed, and effectively captures listeners&#x27; attention and engagement.\n\nBENEFITS\nFlexible working hours (Note: at least half of your working hours would need to overlap with Eastern Time/New York time working hours)\nAccess to dozens of events and training sessions delivered by some of the world&#x27;s leading experts.\nOpportunity to work in a dynamic, creative and collaborative environment.\nIndividual annual development plan and training budget.\nUnlimited Time Off.\n\nHOW TO APPLY\nPlease fill out this  APPLICATION FORM, following the instructions outlined. \nIn this application, you\u2019ll do the following:\nFill out basic information.\nUpload your resume/CV.\nSubmit a cover video describing why you would like to work with us, and what specifically qualifies you for this position.\n-----------------------------\n\n&lt;!DOCTYPE html&gt;\n&lt;!-- saved from url=(0042)file:///C:/Users/alexi/Downloads/rez2.html --&gt;\n&lt;html lang=&quot;en&quot;&gt;&lt;head&gt;&lt;meta http-equiv=&quot;Content-Type&quot; Next, I want the 2 bullet points per role, and I want to keep the results-based theme of each bullet point. I have included the original job posting and resume code below for reference. \n\n****************************\nRemote Membership Coordinator\n\nFULL-TIMEALL OTHER REMOTELATIN AMERICA ONLYEUROPE ONLYCUSTOMER RELATIONSHIP MANAGEMENTPROJECT MANAGEMENTSOCIAL MEDIA MARKETING$25,000 - $48,999 USD\nCoaching.com is hiring a remote Membership Coordinator at We Work Remotely.\nCoaching.com\n United States\n Website\nJOBS POSTED: 21\nApply for this position\nView company profile &amp; all jobs\u2192\n\nTime zones: EST (UTC -5), MST (UTC -7), ART (UTC -3), UTC -4, UTC -4:30, UTC -3, UTC -2, SBT (UTC +11), GMT (UTC +0), CET (UTC +1), EET (UTC +2), MSK (UTC +3)\n\nGENERAL INFORMATION\nDepartment - Membership\nReporting to - Membership Manager &amp; Director\nStart Date  - Immediate\nSalary  - US$28,000.00 annually\n\nROLE PURPOSE\nAt Coaching.com, our mission is to harness the power of coaching worldwide. We achieve this through our Coaching Enablement Platform, offering a comprehensive suite of services designed to support and accelerate coaches&#x27; development. Our services include the Coaching Center of Excellence (a hub for professional development and education), Coaching Management Software, and Coaching Marketplace. Through these platforms, we empower coaches to shape their skills and have a profound impact on human life.\n\nAs a Membership Coordinator at Coaching.com, you will play a vital role in managing and coordinating various aspects of our membership programs and community engagement initiatives. This role is ideal for a proactive, confident and detail-oriented individual who is passionate about supporting professional development and fostering a sense of community among our members.\n\nRESPONSIBILITIES\nThe Membership Coordinator reports directly to the Membership Manager &amp; Membership Director to support the delivery training and education to Coaching.com Members in the Coaching Center of Excellence. \n\nYour main responsibility is to support, coordinate and execute membership delivery tasks, ensuring agreed program milestones are met. The role also has a specific focus on managing volunteer facilitators, hosting and providing technical support on live sessions, and coordinating the monthly newsletter. \n\n1. Membership Project Management:\nSupport the Membership Manager &amp; Director in the development &amp; delivery of Membership features and services. \nSet up, manage and track Membership delivery project plans, its elements and activities\nBe responsible for the successful delivery of all tasks related to the Membership according to the established delivery project plans.\nSchedule meetings, prepare agendas, take notes and share follow-up action-steps with the involved internal stakeholders.\nImplement already established processes and/or workflows for the Membership as required.\n\n2. Membership Delivery:\nCollaborate with the Membership Team on delivery, design &amp; development processes.\nResolve Members\u2019 support requests on a day-to-day basis.\nCoordinate focus groups to gather insights and feedback from members, analyzing data and providing actionable recommendations.\nManage and coordinate volunteer facilitators, allocating sessions, being their point of contact and ensuring they are well-prepared for the sessions they are facilitating. \nCoordinate and curate content for newsletters, ensuring timely and relevant information is shared across teams.\nManage Salesforce emails for the Membership Team, including creating and scheduling email campaigns, tracking performance metrics, and optimizing communications.\nSupport the delivery of live membership sessions on Zoom, including session support, session hosting, logistical coordination, scheduling and content preparation.\nCreate and post content in Coaching.com\u2019s online community. Increase engagement through sharing valuable content and encouraging conversation with members. \nAssist with general administrative tasks related to membership management, including summit coordination, member database maintenance, and documentation.\n\nKEY COMPETENCIES\n\nYou\u2019re experienced:\nYou have a background in Digital Project/Program Management of at least 3 years, in a remote environment. \n\nYou&#x27;re a strong communicator:\nYou have excellent communication in English, spoken, heard, and written. Excellent interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to work with a wide range of external and internal customers and stakeholders from different countries and cultures, handling rapid development and change requests.\n\nYou&#x27;re organized:\nYou are data-driven, and very meticulous in your organization and approach with projects. You love structure! \n\nYou deliver results:\nYou are a dynamic self-starter. You are able to work independently, with your own initiative to achieve agreed aims and objectives and find creative solutions to problems. You love working with autonomy and don&#x27;t enjoy micro-management.\n\nYou&#x27;re adaptable and flexible:\nAbility to work in a fast-paced, high-intensity work environment. Able to proactively manage your own wellbeing and the challenges of maintaining communication and collaboration in a remote environment.\n\nYou\u2019re a confident and energized public speaker:\nYou are comfortable and confident in speaking to large audiences on live online sessions, facilitator meetings and team meetings. Your speaking style is clear, composed, and effectively captures listeners&#x27; attention and engagement.\n\nBENEFITS\nFlexible working hours (Note: at least half of your working hours would need to overlap with Eastern Time/New York time working hours)\nAccess to dozens of events and training sessions delivered by some of the world&#x27;s leading experts.\nOpportunity to work in a dynamic, creative and collaborative environment.\nIndividual annual development plan and training budget.\nUnlimited Time Off.\n\nHOW TO APPLY\nPlease fill out this  APPLICATION FORM, following the instructions outlined. \nIn this application, you\u2019ll do the following:\nFill out basic information.\nUpload your resume/CV.\nSubmit a cover video describing why you would like to work with us, and what specifically qualifies you for this position.\n-----------------------------\n\n&lt;!DOCTYPE html&gt;\n&lt;!-- saved from url=(0042)file:///C:/Users/alexi/Downloads/rez2.html --&gt;\n&lt;html lang=&quot;en&quot;&gt;&lt;head&gt;&lt;meta http-equiv=&quot;Content-Type&quot; "]}, "status": "finished_successfully", "end_turn": null, "weight": 1.0, "metadata": {"request_id": "8677a07d3d0ebb1d-MXP", "timestamp_": "absolute", "message_type": null}, "recipient": "all", "channel": null}, "parent": "02e1a60b-03d4-4d6d-ba2d-b16a34b7c112", "children": ["90105912-78b6-4f90-809f-f668faaa295c", "a60bfcfd-88bb-4219-b916-a86865950fc2"]}, "90105912-78b6-4f90-809f-f668faaa295c": {"id": "90105912-78b6-4f90-809f-f668faaa295c", "message": {"id": "90105912-78b6-4f90-809f-f668faaa295c", "author": {"role": "assistant", "name": null, "metadata": {}}, "create_time": 1710957911.315784, "update_time": null, "content": {"content_type": "text", "parts": ["Whether to leave off some of your work history depends on a few factors:\n\n1. **Relevance:** If earlier jobs are not relevant to the position you&#x27;re applying for, you might consider omitting them. Focus on experiences that showcase skills and achievements related to the role you want.\n\n2. **Length of your resume:** If your resume extends beyond two pages, it might be time to trim older or less relevant positions, especially if they don&#x27;t add value to your current job application.\n\n3. **Career progression:** If older jobs demonstrate your career progression or provide context for your career journey, they might be worth keeping. However, if newer roles more effectively show your qualifications, earlier roles might be less necessary.\n\n4. **Time frame:** Generally, it&#x27;s acceptable to list the last 10-15 years of your work history. Jobs beyond this range can be left off unless they are particularly important for the position you&#x27;re applying for.\n\n5. **Gaps in employment:** If removing older jobs creates large gaps in your employment history, you may need to address these gaps either in your resume or cover letter.\n\n6. **Changing career fields:** If you&#x27;re changing careers, focus on transferable skills and relevant experiences that align with the new field, even if it means omitting earlier roles that are less relevant.\n\nRemember, your resume is a tool to get you an interview. It should highlight your most pertinent experiences, skills, and achievements. Tailor your resume for each application, focusing on what&#x27;s most relevant to the specific job and company. If certain aspects of your work history don&#x27;t support your current job objectives, it may be wise to leave them off to maintain clarity and conciseness."]}, "status": "finished_successfully", "end_turn": true, "weight": 1.0, "metadata": {"finish_details": {"type": "stop", "stop_tokens": [100260]}, "citations": [], "gizmo_id": null, "is_complete": true, "message_type": null, "model_slug": "gpt-4", "pad": "AAAAAAAAAA", "parent_id": "aaa23293-762a-49f6-a2b9-3e358bb4e1ab", "request_id": "8677a07d3d0ebb1d-MXP", "timestamp_": "absolute"}, "recipient": "all", "channel": null}, "parent": "aaa23293-762a-49f6-a2b9-3e358bb4e1ab", "children": []}, "a60bfcfd-88bb-4219-b916-a86865950fc2": {"id": "a60bfcfd-88bb-4219-b916-a86865950fc2", "message": {"id": "a60bfcfd-88bb-4219-b916-a86865950fc2", "author": {"role": "assistant", "name": null, "metadata": {}}, "create_time": 1710957912.07284, "update_time": null, "content": {"content_type": "text", "parts": ["Yes, in some cases, it&#x27;s advisable to tailor your resume by selectively including work history that is most relevant and recent, especially for positions that align closely with the job you&#x27;re applying for. "metadata": {}}, "create_time": 1711391664.619728, "update_time": null, "content": {"content_type": "text", "parts": ["Peanut oil is high in fat, as all oils are, but the types of fats it contains are what matter. It&#x27;s primarily composed of monounsaturated and polyunsaturated fats, which are considered healthier fats because they can help to reduce cholesterol levels and lower the risk of heart disease. However, it does contain some saturated fats as well.\n\nIn terms of triglycerides, consuming fats like those found in peanut oil doesn&#x27;t directly translate to high levels of triglycerides in the blood. In fact, replacing saturated fats with monounsaturated fats (like those found in peanut oil) can help to lower triglyceride levels. However, excessive calorie intake, including from fats, can lead to increased triglyceride levels in the body. So, while peanut oil itself isn&#x27;t high in triglycerides, overconsumption of any type of fat can contribute to higher triglyceride levels in the blood."]}, "status": "finished_successfully", "end_turn": true, "weight": 1.0, "metadata": {"finish_details": {"type": "stop", "stop_tokens": [100260]}, "citations": [], "gizmo_id": null, "is_complete": true, "message_type": null, "model_slug": "gpt-4", "default_model_slug": "gpt-4", "pad": "AAAAAAAA", "parent_id": "913e39e2-8092-42e3-b2eb-14fc0281f608", "request_id": "86a0fe7fbb6ebadc-MXP", "timestamp_": "absolute"}, "recipient": "all", "channel": null}, "parent": "913e39e2-8092-42e3-b2eb-14fc0281f608", "children": ["8ec9cd51-5b32-45a6-8a4d-53c8c57e78cc"]}, "8ec9cd51-5b32-45a6-8a4d-53c8c57e78cc": {"id": "8ec9cd51-5b32-45a6-8a4d-53c8c57e78cc", "message": {"id": "8ec9cd51-5b32-45a6-8a4d-53c8c57e78cc", "author": {"role": "user", "name": null, "metadata": {}}, "create_time": 1711391720.084785, "update_time": null, "content": {"content_type": "text", "parts": ["Is peanut pil or olive oil better? "]}, "status": "finished_successfully", "end_turn": null, "weight": 1.0, "metadata": {"request_id": "86a100097bf6badc-MXP", "timestamp_": "absolute", "message_type": null}, "recipient": "all", "channel": null}, "parent": "932cd5be-e108-4679-a8ce-75e38700e35b", "children": ["0d230d05-2bfb-414e-bc57-e3ddad76d2f3"]}, "0d230d05-2bfb-414e-bc57-e3ddad76d2f3": {"id": "0d230d05-2bfb-414e-bc57-e3ddad76d2f3", "message": {"id": "0d230d05-2bfb-414e-bc57-e3ddad76d2f3", "author": {"role": "assistant", "name": null, "metadata": {}}, "create_time": 1711391745.337936, "update_time": null, "content": {"content_type": "text", "parts": ["Choosing between peanut oil and olive oil depends on several factors, including your health goals, cooking needs, and taste preferences.\n\n**Health Benefits:**\n- **Olive Oil:** Particularly extra virgin olive oil, is renowned for its health benefits. It&#x27;s rich in monounsaturated fats, particularly oleic acid, which can help reduce inflammation and have beneficial effects on genes linked to cancer. Olive oil is also packed with antioxidants and has been associated with heart health, including reducing the risk of heart disease.\n- **Peanut Oil:** While it also contains monounsaturated fats, peanut oil has a higher proportion of polyunsaturated fats compared to olive oil. It is healthier than oils high in saturated fats but doesn&#x27;t contain as many antioxidants as olive oil. However, it&#x27;s still a good choice for reducing cholesterol levels and improving heart health when used in moderation.\n\n**Cooking Use:**\n- **Olive Oil:** Extra virgin olive oil has a lower smoke point compared to peanut oil, making it less ideal for high-heat cooking methods like frying. However, it&#x27;s excellent for dressings, marinades, and low-to-medium heat cooking. \n- **Peanut Oil:** It has a higher smoke point, making it a better option for frying, deep-frying, and high-heat cooking. It&#x27;s also relatively flavor-neutral, which can be a plus when cooking dishes where you don&#x27;t want the oil to impart its own taste.\n\n**Flavor:**\n- **Olive Oil:** Offers a distinct taste that varies from fruity to bitter and spicy, depending on the type and quality. Extra virgin olive oil has a more pronounced flavor compared to light or refined olive oils.\n- **Peanut Oil:** Generally has a milder flavor, making it more versatile for various dishes, especially if you don&#x27;t want the oil to affect the taste of your food.\n\n**Allergies:**\n- **Peanut Oil:** Can be a concern for people with peanut allergies, although highly refined peanut oil is less likely to cause a reaction than unrefined. Still, caution is advised.\n- **Olive Oil:** Is typically safe for people with nut allergies, making it a more universally suitable option.\n\nIn summary, if you&#x27;re looking for an oil with significant health benefits and distinctive flavor for low to medium heat cooking or dressings, olive oil might be the better choice. If you need an oil for high-heat cooking and prefer a more neutral taste, peanut oil could be more appropriate. Always consider your dietary needs and cooking style when choosing between the two."]}, "status": "finished_successfully", "end_turn": true, "weight": 1.0, "metadata": {"finish_details": {"type": Here are some recommendations to help you turn your scenes into chapters that flow smoothly and move the story along:\n\n1. **Define Chapter Goals:**\n   - Clearly define the goals of each chapter. What do you want to achieve in terms of character development, plot progression, or thematic exploration?\n\n2. **Establish a Scene Structure:**\n   - Divide each chapter into scenes, and within each scene, identify the key narrative elements, dialogues, and actions that need to take place.\n   - Ensure each scene has a purpose and contributes to the overall chapter goal.\n\n3. **Use Transitions:**\n   - Smooth transitions are essential. Clearly indicate scene changes by using descriptive transitions that set the stage for the upcoming events.\n   - Consider using location or time changes, character perspectives, or thematic shifts to signal transitions.\n\n4. **Balance Dialogue and Narration:**\n   - Find a balance between dialogue and narration. Dialogues bring characters to life and advance the plot, while narration provides context, description, and internal thoughts.\n   - Use dialogue to reveal character personalities, convey emotions, and drive conflicts forward.\n\n5. **Create Tension and Resolution:**\n   - Introduce tension or conflict within scenes to maintain reader interest. This could be through character clashes, unexpected events, or unresolved issues.\n   - Resolve or address some of the tension within each chapter, but leave enough unresolved to keep readers eager for the next.\n\n6. **Consider Pacing:**\n   - Pay attention to the pacing of your chapters. Balance action-packed scenes with slower, introspective moments to create a dynamic reading experience.\n   - Adjust the pace based on the emotional tone and narrative requirements of each chapter.\n\n7. **Connect Themes Across Chapters:**\n   - Establish thematic threads that weave through multiple chapters. This creates a cohesive narrative and allows for the exploration of overarching ideas.\n   - Consistency in themes helps in creating a unified and meaningful storyline.\n\n8. **End Chapters with Hooks:**\n   - End each chapter with a hook or a question to entice readers to continue. This could be a revelation, a cliffhanger, or a shift in perspective.\n   - Make readers curious about what will happen next.\n\n9. **Review and Revise:**\n   - Regularly review your work to ensure that each chapter contributes meaningfully to the overall narrative.\n   - Revise scenes and dialogues for clarity, conciseness, and impact.\n\n10. **Seek Feedback:**\n    - Share your chapters with trusted beta readers or writing partners to get feedback on the pacing, structure, and overall impact.\n    - Consider making adjustments based on constructive feedback.\n\nRemember, storytelling is an evolving process, and finding the right balance between scenes, dialogues, and narrative elements may require some experimentation and fine-tuning."]}, "status": "finished_successfully", "end_turn": true, "weight": 1.0, "metadata": {"finish_details": {"type": "stop", "stop_tokens": [100260]}, "citations": [], "gizmo_id": null, "is_complete": true, "message_type": null, "model_slug": "text-davinci-002-render-sha", "parent_id": "aaa28a2c-a313-4fd6-8fee-767f31298c85", "request_id": "859bd3f99ccaa262-FCO", "timestamp_": "absolute"}, "recipient": "all", "channel": null}, "parent": "aaa28a2c-a313-4fd6-8fee-767f31298c85", "children": ["aaa2b679-727d-4f28-9baa-3027622a4072"]}, "aaa2b679-727d-4f28-9baa-3027622a4072": {"id": "aaa2b679-727d-4f28-9baa-3027622a4072", "message": {"id": "aaa2b679-727d-4f28-9baa-3027622a4072", "author": {"role": "user", "name": null, "metadata": {}}, "create_time": 1709588415.429163, "update_time": null, "content": {"content_type": "text", "parts": ["**Harnessing the Power of Intention: Transforming Emotions and Shaping Our Reality**\n\nImagine a typical morning scenario: rushing out of the house, missing your train, and finding yourself stranded on a crowded platform. In this all-too-familiar setting, it&#x27;s hard to believe that happiness could be a matter of personal choice. Yet, emerging scientific research and philosophical debates suggest that our intentions and willpower significantly shape our emotional experiences and realities.\n\nThe concept of conscious intention and its role in our actions has been scrutinized by researchers like Haggard (2005), who explored how our brain prepares for action and how this relates to our subjective experience of intention. Contrary to the traditional belief in free will, Haggard&#x27;s findings suggest that the feeling of intending to act arises from the brain&#x27;s preparation for action, highlighting the predictive nature of motor control mechanisms. This scientific perspective challenges the notion of direct mind-body causation but supports the idea that by focusing our intention, we may harness the brain&#x27;s predictive capacities to influence our emotional states [(Haggard, 2005)](https://consensus.app/papers/intention-motor-cognition-haggard/17b609fc3d54561e8cd455f937a543c6/?utm_source=chatgpt).\n\nPhilosophically, the debate around intention and volition delves deeper into human agency. Adams and Mele (1992) discuss how intentions, combined with efforts and feedback, fulfill the roles ascribed to volition, suggesting that our actions are more a result of a complex interplay between intention and trying rather than sheer willpower alone. This aligns with the notion that deciding to adopt a positive outlook could indeed reshape one&#x27;s emotional landscape [(Adams &amp; Mele, 1992)](https://consensus.app/papers/intentionvolition-debate1-adams/5bd4a67f0a4a56afb45781648f62a7f9/?utm_source=chatgpt).\n\nRollo May (1965) further illuminates the power of intentionality, arguing that it is at the heart of consciousness and human will. Intentionality, as a state of being, encompasses our total orientation towards the world at any given time, which could be contrary to our conscious intentions. This suggests that by realigning our deeper intentionality, we could transform our experience of reality, transcending the immediate negativity of a moment like missing a train [(May, 1965)](https://consensus.app/papers/intentionality-heart-human-will-may/359696f4be6e5b72a375f17be118d00e/?utm_source=chatgpt).\n\nFurthermore, Fitch and Ravlin (2005) explore how willpower and perceived behavioral control influence our actions and emotional responses. Their research indicates that higher willpower correlates with behavior more consistent with one&#x27;s intentions. This supports the idea that strengthening our willpower and controlling our focus could enable us to maintain a sense of inner peace amidst chaos [(Fitch &amp; Ravlin, 2005)](https://consensus.app/papers/willpower-perceived-control-influences-fitch/99d5941af38155b98d9f6fab0f9a2c52/?utm_source=chatgpt).\n\nWhat these studies collectively suggest is that while our immediate circumstances might prompt automatic negative reactions, the broader capacity of our intentions\u2014shaped by complex neurological processes, philosophical understandings, and psychological efforts\u2014can significantly influence our emotional state. The scenario on the train platform, rather than being a moment of despair, can become an opportunity for practicing this power of intention. Haggard&#x27;s groundbreaking work reveals that our brains start gearing up for action before we even realize it, suggesting that our intentions have a tangible impact on our neural pathways [(Haggard, 2005)].\n\n**Philosophical Musings: Intentions vs. Willpower**\n\nDelving deeper into the realm of philosophy, thinkers like Adams and Mele engage in thought-provoking debates about intention and willpower. Their findings suggest that cultivating strong willpower enables us to maintain inner peace and resilience, even in the face of chaos [(Fitch &amp; Ravlin, 2005)].\n\n**Conclusion: The Power of Intention in Everyday Life**\n\nIn conclusion, the interplay between intention, willpower, and emotional experiences offers a transformative perspective on navigating life&#x27;s rollercoaster. While external circumstances may influence our emotions, the power of intention empowers us to shape our reality and cultivate happiness from within.\n\n**Further Exploration: Delving Deeper into the Science and Philosophy of Intention**\n\nFor those intrigued by the interplay between intention, willpower, and emotion, further exploration into the realms of cognitive neuroscience, philosophy of mind, and psychology may provide additional insights and practical strategies for harnessing this transformative power.\n\n---\n\nThis structure maintains a cozy journalistic feel while incorporating headings for clarity and SEO optimization. You dash out the door, only to miss your train and find yourself stranded on a crowded platform, frustrated and overwhelmed by the chaos of everyday life. It&#x27;s moments like these that make us question: Can we truly choose happiness, even when life throws us curveballs?\n\nAs we explore the fascinating realm of intention and its impact on our emotions and reality, let&#x27;s consider some practical strategies gleaned from both scientific research and philosophical musings that can help us navigate life&#x27;s ups and downs with greater resilience and inner peace.\n\n**The Science of Intention: Rewiring Our Brain for Positivity**\n\nIn the realm of neuroscience, pioneering researchers like Haggard have uncovered fascinating insights into the power of intention. Haggard&#x27;s groundbreaking work suggests that our brains begin preparing for action before we&#x27;re even consciously aware of it, indicating that our intentions have a direct impact on our neural pathways [(Haggard, 2005)].\n\nOne practical way to leverage this insight is by starting our day with a clear intention or goal in mind. Setting a positive intention can help prime our brain for success and focus our energy on what matters most to us.\n\n**Philosophical Musings: Intentions vs. Willpower**\n\nVenturing into the realm of philosophy, scholars such as Adams and Mele engage in thought-provoking debates surrounding intention and willpower. They propose that our actions are influenced not only by sheer will but also by the intricate interplay between intention, effort, and feedback [(Adams &amp; Mele, 1992)].\n\nTo cultivate a mindset of resilience, we can reframe challenges as opportunities for growth. Embracing a &quot;growth mindset&quot; enables us to approach difficulties with optimism and determination, aligning our intentions with our actions.\n\n**Embracing Intentionality: Finding Peace in the Chaos**\n\nRenowned philosopher Rollo May sheds light on the concept of intentionality as the cornerstone of human will. May&#x27;s insights urge us to realign our deeper intentions to reshape our perception of reality, even in the face of adversity [(May, 1965)].\n\nTo practice intentionality in our daily lives, we can incorporate mindfulness techniques. Staying present and fully engaged in the moment allows us to cultivate a sense of inner peace and acceptance, regardless of external circumstances.\n\n**The Role of Willpower: Strengthening Our Mental Resilience**\n\nFurther studies by Fitch and Ravlin underscore the vital role of willpower in shaping our actions and emotional responses. Their findings suggest that nurturing strong willpower allows us to maintain inner calm and resilience, even amidst life&#x27;s most challenging moments [(Fitch &amp; Ravlin, 2005)].\n\nTo build our willpower &quot;muscle,&quot; we can set small, achievable goals and gradually increase the level of challenge. Celebrating our successes along the way reinforces positive behaviors and strengthens our resolve.\n\n**Conclusion: Empowering Ourselves Through Intention**\n\nIn conclusion, the interplay between intention, willpower, and emotional experiences offers a profound perspective on navigating life&#x27;s ups and downs. While external circumstances may sway our emotions, the power of intention empowers us to take control of our reality and foster happiness from within.\n\nTo live with intentionality is to take proactive steps to align our intentions with our actions and values. Their findings suggest that nurturing strong willpower allows us to maintain inner calm and\n        resilience, even amidst life&#x27;s most challenging moments (&lt;a href=&quot;#FitchRavlin&quot;&gt;Fitch &amp; Ravlin, 2005&lt;/a&gt;).\n    &lt;/p&gt;\n\n    &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Tip:&lt;/strong&gt; To build our willpower &quot;muscle,&quot; we can set small, achievable goals and gradually\n        increase the level of challenge. Celebrating our successes along the way reinforces positive behaviors and\n        strengthens our resolve.&lt;/p&gt;\n\n    &lt;h2&gt;Conclusion: Empowering Ourselves Through Intention&lt;/h2&gt;\n\n    &lt;p&gt;In conclusion, the interplay between intention, willpower, and emotional experiences offers a profound\n        perspective on navigating life&#x27;s ups and downs. While external circumstances may sway our emotions, the power\n        of intention empowers us to take control of our reality and foster happiness from within.&lt;/p&gt;\n\n    &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Tip:&lt;/strong&gt; To live with intentionality is to take proactive steps to align our intentions with our\n        actions and values. By doing so, we create a life that is meaningful and fulfilling, regardless of external\n        circumstances.&lt;/p&gt;\n\n    &lt;h2&gt;Further Exploration: Diving Deeper into Intention and Its Impact&lt;/h2&gt;\n\n    &lt;p&gt;For those intrigued by the dynamics of intention, willpower, and emotion, delving into the realms of cognitive\n        neuroscience, philosophy of mind, and psychology promises additional insights and practical strategies for\n        unlocking our full potential.&lt;/p&gt;\n\n    &lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Tip:&lt;/strong&gt; Haggard&#x27;s groundbreaking work suggests that our brains begin preparing for action before we&#x27;re even consciously aware of it, indicating that our intentions have a direct impact on our neural pathways [(Haggard, 2005)].\n\nOne practical way to leverage this insight is by starting our day with a clear intention or goal in mind. Setting a positive intention can help prime our brain for success and focus our energy on what matters most to us.\n\n**Philosophical Musings: Intentions vs. Willpower**\n\nVenturing into the realm of philosophy, scholars such as Adams and Mele engage in thought-provoking debates surrounding intention and willpower. They propose that our actions are influenced not only by sheer will but also by the intricate interplay between intention, effort, and feedback [(Adams &amp; Mele, 1992)].\n\nTo cultivate a mindset of resilience, we can reframe challenges as opportunities for growth. Embracing a &quot;growth mindset&quot; enables us to approach difficulties with optimism and determination, aligning our intentions with our actions.\n\n**Embracing Intentionality: Finding Peace in the Chaos**\n\nRenowned philosopher Rollo May sheds light on the concept of intentionality as the cornerstone of human will. May&#x27;s insights urge us to realign our deeper intentions to reshape our perception of reality, even in the face of adversity [(May, 1965)].\n\nTo practice intentionality in our daily lives, we can incorporate mindfulness techniques. Staying present and fully engaged in the moment allows us to cultivate a sense of inner peace and acceptance, regardless of external circumstances.\n\n**The Role of Willpower: Strengthening Our Mental Resilience**\n\nFurther studies by Fitch and Ravlin underscore the vital role of willpower in shaping our actions and emotional responses. Their findings suggest that nurturing strong willpower allows us to maintain inner calm and resilience, even amidst life&#x27;s most challenging moments [(Fitch &amp; Ravlin, 2005)].\n\nTo build our willpower &quot;muscle,&quot; we can set small, achievable goals and gradually increase the level of challenge. Here are a few related concepts and movements:\n\n1. **Communism**: Communism is a socio-economic system and political ideology that advocates for the collective ownership of the means of production and the abolition of private property. In traditional Marxist theory, communism aims for a classless society where resources are shared equally among all members.\n\n2. **Communalism**: Communalism emphasizes community ownership and control of resources, with a focus on local governance and decision-making. It often involves decentralized structures and direct democracy at the community level.\n\n3. **Anarcho-Communism**: Anarcho-communism combines anarchist principles with communist ideals, advocating for a stateless, classless society based on voluntary associations and the common ownership of resources.\n\n4. **Resource-Based Economy (RBE)**: A resource-based economy proposes the management of resources based on technical and scientific knowledge rather than monetary systems. It advocates for the efficient and equitable distribution of resources to meet human needs, often with an emphasis on sustainability and technological innovation.\n\n5. **Commons-based Peer Production**: This concept refers to collaborative efforts to create and manage shared resources, often facilitated by digital platforms and open-source principles. Examples include Wikipedia and open-source software projects like Linux.\n\nWhile your concept of &quot;collective communism&quot; shares elements with these ideologies, it also introduces unique aspects such as the idea of a global resource community and the absence of centralized repositories. However, the broader principles of communal ownership, resource sharing, and a focus on community well-being align with various existing movements and ideas."]}, "status": "finished_successfully", "end_turn": true, "weight": 1.0, "metadata": {"finish_details": {"type": "stop", "stop_tokens": [100260]}, "citations": [], "gizmo_id": null, "is_complete": true, "message_type": null, "model_slug": "text-davinci-002-render-sha", "parent_id": "aaa2fddc-5a96-451a-89b5-c7bc86918017", "request_id": "860c1390d99da259-FCO", "timestamp_": "absolute"}, "recipient": "all", "channel": null}, "parent": "aaa2fddc-5a96-451a-89b5-c7bc86918017", "children": ["d15556ea-f110-4bfc-bc41-3aa31955168a"]}, "d15556ea-f110-4bfc-bc41-3aa31955168a": {"id": "d15556ea-f110-4bfc-bc41-3aa31955168a", "message": {"id": "d15556ea-f110-4bfc-bc41-3aa31955168a", "author": {"role": "user", "name": null, "metadata": {}}, "create_time": 1711105306.045401, "update_time": null, "content": {"content_type": "text", "parts": ["Hey, can you write me prompt to bring the next bill instance of you up to speed about everything we created? "]}, "status": "finished_successfully", "end_turn": null, "weight": 1.0, "metadata": {"request_id": "86544087ed0c0e13-MXP", "timestamp_": "absolute", "message_type": null}, "recipient": "all", "channel": null}, "parent": "b55e89d2-9505-4f2f-a2ca-fc662d8c752c", "children": ["c7c281e5-5354-4773-8fc4-45a2d5b1181c"]}, "c7c281e5-5354-4773-8fc4-45a2d5b1181c": {"id": "c7c281e5-5354-4773-8fc4-45a2d5b1181c", "message": {"id": "c7c281e5-5354-4773-8fc4-45a2d5b1181c", "author": {"role": "assistant", "name": null, "metadata": {}}, "create_time": 1710586970.991115, "update_time": null, "content": {"content_type": "text", "parts": ["Squishy lumps on a dog can be caused by various conditions, and while they might not always be serious, it&#x27;s important to have them checked by a veterinarian. Here are some possible causes:\n\n1. **Lipomas**: These are the most common soft, squishy lumps found on dogs. Lipomas are benign (non-cancerous) fatty tumors that are usually harmless and don&#x27;t need to be removed unless they interfere with the dog&#x27;s movement or quality of life.\n\n2. **Cysts**: There are various types of cysts that can appear on dogs. Sebaceous cysts, for example, are filled with sebum and can occur when a sebaceous gland becomes blocked. Most cysts are benign but can sometimes become infected.\n\n3. **Abscesses**: These are lumps filled with pus that can result from an infection. Abscesses can be soft or hard and might be painful. They typically require treatment, which may include draining and antibiotics.\n\n4. **Hematomas**: These are swellings filled with blood that usually result from an injury. Hematomas can feel soft or squishy and might resolve on their own, but in some cases, they might need to be drained by a vet.\n\n5. **Allergic Reactions**: In some cases, an allergic reaction can cause soft, squishy swellings on the skin. This could be a reaction to a bite, sting, or something in the dog&#x27;s environment.\n\n6. **Edema**: This is swelling caused by fluid retention in the body&#x27;s tissues. It can occur for various reasons, including heart failure, liver disease, or local inflammation due to injury or infection.\n\nWhile these are some common causes, there are other possibilities, and only a vet can provide a proper diagnosis. If you notice a new lump or bump on your dog, it&#x27;s a good idea to monitor its size, texture, and color, and whether it changes over time. Then, consult a vet who can assess it, possibly perform a fine-needle aspirate or biopsy, and advise on whether any treatment is needed."]}, "status": "finished_successfully", "end_turn": true, an income from streaming. We work with various payment processors, including PayPal, giving you more ways to monetize your channel than anyone else in the industry. Most importantly, setting up a tip page is entirely free. What\u2019s more, we will never take a cut of the money you receive. Setting up your tip page only takes a few seconds, so let\u2019s dive into it.\n\nIf you are logging into Streamlabs.com for the first time, the onboarding process will ask you to add your Paypal email address or other support payment processor. Once you finish that step, your tip page is ready to go; this is the fastest way to set up your donation page, but if you\u2019ve already logged in or skipped the onboarding, you can also set up your tip page from the settings.\n\nTo do that:\n\n  * 1) Log in to the dashboard on Streamlabs.com. Click on \u2018Settings\u2019 in the lower left-hand corner.\n\n[Image 8: Streamlabs settings menu] \n\n  * 2) Click on Donation Settings &gt; Methods and choose your preferred Payment Processor.\n\n[Image 9: Streamlabs settings page] \n\n  * 3) Go through the necessary steps to connect your account.\n\n[Image 10: Streamlabs connect paypal] \n\n  * 4) After your account is connected, your tip page will be available at streamlabs.com/USERNAME.\n\n[Image 11: Streamlabs tip page] \n\n## Manage Tip Page Settings\n\nYou can manage a range of tip page settings from the Streamlabs dashboard. Not based in the US? Choose which currency you\u2019d like donations to appear in. Set the minimum amount required to donate, and even adjust the recommended amount that appears for a user when they visit your tip page.\n\nEdit the message that appears on your page when users visit, adjust profanity filters to block out offensive words, and even customize the image that appears as your donation page header.\n\nVisit the\u00a0\u301086\u2020dashboard\u3011\u00a0to view all of the tip page settings.\n\n## Adding Tip Page Link\n\nDepending on the platform you choose, the process to add a link to your tip page is going to be different. Both YouTube Gaming and Facebook Gaming only allow you to copy and paste a link to your Tip Page in your page description or about section. Twitch takes it one step further and gives you the option to add customized panels.\n\n### Add a Twitch Tip Panel\n\nIn the upper-right corner, click your profile icon.\n\n[Image 12: Twitch profile icon]\n\nSelect Channel from the drop-down menu.\n\n[Image 13: Twitch channel menu]\n\nClick the About section on the next screen.\n\n[Image 14: Twitch about]\n\nToggle the Edit Panels option in the top left section of the screen.\n\n[Image 15: Twitch edit panels]\n\nScroll down and click the box with a large plus sign in it and then click &quot;Add a Text or Image Panel&quot;.\n\n[Image 16: Twitch Add a Text or Image Panel]\n\nNow you can add a title to your panel, the link to your Streamlabs Tip Page, a Description, and an image.\n\n[Image 17: Twitch Panel title]\n\n### Need an Image?\n\nWe\u2019ve recently rolled out a new feature giving streamers the ability to add professionally designed panels from a selection of over 50 different templates.\n\nVisit our\u00a0\u301087\u2020Panel Maker page on the Streamlabs Dashboard\u3011\u00a0to start designing your own panels today.\n\n[Image 18: Streamlabs Panel maker] \n\n## Subscriptions\n\nUnlike tips or donations, subscriptions provide you with a more reliable source of income. If you want to become a full-time streamer, you\u2019ll need this supplemental revenue to assist you along the way.\n\nIn this section, we will be discussing how you can monetize your live stream through subscriptions. We\u2019ll specifically discuss the benefits and differences between Twitch subscriptions, YouTube Channel Memberships, and Facebook Fan Subscriptions. We will also discuss how to persuade your viewers to invest in your content and what benefits you can provide to convince them to stay subscribed.\n\n[Image 19: Streamlabs Subscriptions] \n\n## Subscriptions at a Glance\n\nTwitch Subscriptions YouTube Channel Membership Facebook Fan Subscription  \n\nCost\n\n$4.99, $9.99, $24.99\n\nStarting at 4.99, with the ability to \u301088\u2020customize price points\u2020support.google.com\u3011\n\n$4.99  \n\nCommission\n\n50%\n\n30%\n\nAs of August 2020 and for the next year, Facebook will not be taking any fees from Fan Subscriptions.  \n\nRequirements\n\nTwitch streamers must be either a Twitch Affiliate or a Twitch Partner.\n\nVisit our \u301089\u2020guide\u3011 for tips to help you become an affiliate\n\n30,000 subscribers; Gaming channels must have at least 1,000\n\nMember of YouTube Partner Program\n\n10,000 followers or 250+ Return Viewers and one of the following in the last 60 days:\n\n- 50,000 Post Engagements\n\n- 180,000 watch minutes  \n\n## Twitch Subscriber Benefits\n\nThere are a few &quot;built-in\u201d perks, but many streamers add a few bonus ones for those who support them monetarily. These are as follows:\n\n  * Ad-Free Viewing\u00a0\u2013 As a subscriber, Twitch will not force you to watch ads before you start watching a stream (with limited exceptions).\n  * Sub-Badges\u00a0\u2013 Custom badges are unlocked when you subscribe to a streamer. Badges are displayed next to a viewer&#x27;s name when they participate in the channel&#x27;s chat. Streamers can customize badges, and viewers will generally receive new badges the longer they stay subscribed. You start with the 1-month badge and get new badges for three months, six months, etc.\n  * Emotes\u00a0\u2013 Once a streamer reaches affiliate status, custom emotes become available. It is a fantastic way to reinforce your branding as a streamer because viewers can use them across all Twitch channels. The number of subscribers a streamer has dictates the number of emotes a streamer can have.\n  * Sub-Only Chat/Streams\u00a0\u2013 Occasionally, a streamer will host a sub-only stream. Hosting a stream for your most dedicated viewers is a great way to encourage viewers to sub. During these streams, only subscribers can view the broadcast. Streamers can also set their chat to &quot;subscribers only.&quot;\n\n[Image 20: Twitch Subscriptions at a Glance]\n\n## Facebook Fan Subscription Benefits\n\nThere are a few &quot;built-in\u201d perks, but many streamers add a few bonus ones for those who support them monetarily. These are as follows:\n\n  * Exclusive content:\u00a0Publish posts, videos, and other content exclusively to your most loyal supporters. Exclusive content generally includes:\n  * Supporter-only polls or Q&amp;As:\u00a0give supporters more ways to engage and interact with you.\n  * Behind-the-scenes:\u00a0Give viewers a look at the production and day to day activity of your live stream.\n  * Exclusive live videos:\u00a0Private live videos can provide an opportunity to answer questions and gain feedback from your community.\n  * Discounts:\u00a0Provide discount codes for merch, events, or other products through supporter only messages or posts.\n\nIn addition to these benefits, you can also provide supporters with:\n\n  * Recognition with\u00a0\u301090\u2020shout outs\u2020www.facebook.com\u3011\u00a0in public posts.\n  * Early access to your content with supporter-only Premieres or Watch Parties that later go public.\n\n[Image 21: Facebook Fan Subscription Benefits]\n\n## YouTube Channel Membership Benefits\n\nDifferent perks are available based on the various membership levels available. Streamers can offer multiple membership levels, which all have different prices. Remember, perks build on each other. The highest-priced membership levels will have access to the perks offered at lower-priced levels.\n\n  * Members-only Community posts\u00a0- Use the community tab to share content only with members. You can also share Community posts with members at specific levels.\n  * Members-only video\u00a0- Set videos that can only be seen by your members. Anyone can find a members-only video, but only members at the right level(s) can watch it.\n  * Members-only live streams\u00a0- Share a live stream exclusively with your members. Members will be notified when you post a link to the live stream with a members-only post in Community.\n  * Members-only live chat\u00a0- Make the chat members-only during public live streams. Everyone can still view the live stream, but only members will be able to post chats.\n  * Custom channel badges\u00a0- Members will stand out in live chat, comments, and the Community tab via exclusive members-only badges\n  * Custom emoji\u00a0- Members will gain access to one or more exclusive custom emoji that can be sent via YouTube in video comments. It can also be sent in any of your live chats.\n\n[Image 22: YouTube Channel Membership Benefits]\n\n## How to Convince Viewers to Subscribe\n\nSetting unique perks for viewers is a great way to convince others to invest in your content. These will vary from channel to channel, but some of the most common perks include:\n\n  * Exclusive Chatroom on Discord\u00a0\u2013 Many streamers create exclusive discord servers for their subscribers and members.\n  * Play with Viewers\u00a0\u2013 some streamers set aside days where they play games with their subscribers.\n  * Competitions/Giveaways\u00a0\u2013 Streamers can create special contests or giveaways for their subscribers. These are their way of giving back to their supportive community.\n  * Custom Subscriber Alerts\u00a0\u2013 Create unique alerts that only play when someone subscribes to your channel. Streamlabs makes setting up alerts easy, so be sure to\u00a0\u301091\u2020read our guide\u3011\u00a0to learn how to start creating unique alerts.\n\n## Products and Services\n\nFor most content creators, tips ", "title": "How to Make Money Streaming | Streamlabs\t", "tether_id": null}, "status": "finished_successfully", "end_turn": null, "weight": 0.0, "metadata": {"_cite_metadata": {"citation_format": {"name": "tether_og", "regex": "\u3010(\\d+)(?::(\\d+))?\u2020([^\u2020\u3010\u3011]*)[^\u3010\u3011]*?\u3011"}, "metadata_list": [{"type": "webpage", "title": "How to Make Money Streaming | Streamlabs\t", "url": "https://streamlabs.com/content-hub/post/how-to-make-money-streaming", "text": "\n[Image 7: How to Make Money Via Subscriptions]\n\n## Create a Streamlabs Tip Page\n\nSetting up a Streamlabs tip page is one of the easiest ways to start earning an income from streaming. Some of the most common ones for streamers are:\n\n  * StreamElements for one-time donations and tips. This platform integrates easily with Twitch, YouTube, Facebook Gaming and Trovo, and it offers different payment options.\n  * Patreon for regular donations/subscriptions. With the ability to let patrons set monthly pledges, Patreon is the closest you can get to a subscription system without going through a streaming platform\u2019s program.\n  * GoFundMe or Kickstarter for project-based funding. If you have a project to complete and you\u2019re looking for funding, set up pages on these websites and use your live streams to promote it.\n\nIf you stream with \u30101\u2020Restream\u3011, you can easily add a Patreon or GoFundMe \u301016\u2020link as a QR code\u2020support.restream.io\u3011 that you can display as an overlay on your stream.\n\nFor most of these services, you should consider creating special rewards and content for the people who support you. Decide carefully which content goes behind the paywall and which stays free, though. You can\u2019t keep all your best stuff locked behind a subscription; some of it has to stay free to attract new viewers.\n\n## 3. Paid subscriptions from viewers \n\nGetting an occasional tip from your viewers is great, but regular payments are better. These payments will usually net you a couple of dollars each, but if you can get enough of them, they add up. You\u2019ll need to meet certain requirements to enable this kind of support, as platforms reserve it for members of their content creator programs.\n\nHere\u2019s an overview of recurring payment features on the major platforms:\n\n  * YouTube has a \u301024\u2020channel membership program\u2020creatoracademy.youtube.com\u3011 that allows users to subscribe to its channels with monthly payments. To open your YouTube channel (where you group your videos) to this opportunity, you need to be in the \u301025\u2020YouTube Partner Program\u2020support.google.com\u3011 and meet additional eligibility requirements.\n  * Twitch has a \u301026\u2020paid subscription program\u2020www.twitch.tv\u3011 that lets you earn from paid subscriptions if you\u2019re an \u301020\u2020Affiliate\u3011 or Partner. Your viewers get one subscription for free through Twitch Prime, or they can pay for them using PayPal, Amazon Pay, or credit cards.\n  * Facebook Gaming \u301027\u2020extended its Fan Subscriptions feature\u2020www.facebook.com\u3011 to Level Up gaming content creators. You must achieve a certain number of returning weekly viewers, and the feature is only available in certain regions.\n\nIf the platform allows it, you should make content that\u2019s exclusive to your subscribers. It\u2019s a nice way to show your most loyal viewers that you appreciate their support. Also, remember to give a shoutout to people when they subscribe and a mention on their subscription anniversaries.\n\nYou can also use third-party services like Patreon to set up recurring payments or subscriptions from fans.\n\n## 4. Revenue from ads \n\nAdvertising revenue powers half the internet, including Google services and Facebook. Why not you too? If you join the right streaming platform or social network, you can start earning some decent ad money.\n\nWhen you start broadcasting live videos on a specific platform, like YouTube or Facebook, you may be able to take advantage of their advertising programs. Here\u2019s a breakdown of the different types of in-stream ads that are usually available:\n\n  * Pre-roll ads: These ads play as soon as a viewer clicks on your stream. They have to view the ad before they can start watching your content.\n  * Mid-roll ads: Mid-roll ads play in the middle of your live stream. Your stream continues in a smaller window while the ad takes up most of the screen.\n  * Display and overlay ads: These types of ads usually pop up as banners or small cards on top of your stream.\n\nIf you want to generate revenue with ads, join these platforms:\n\n  * \u301028\u2020YouTube\u2020support.google.com\u3011 offers pre-roll and mid-roll ads, as well as display and overlay ads.\n  * \u301029\u2020Facebook\u2020www.facebook.com\u3011 offers mid-roll ads if you meet the viewership number criteria.\n  * \u301030\u2020Twitch\u2020www.twitch.tv\u3011 offers in-stream ads, as well as display and native ad opportunities.\n\nAdvertising in live streaming is a hot topic and a regular cause of controversy. Try to exercise as much control as you can over the advertisements displayed during your streams or on your channel. Also, remember that viewers can use ad-blocking software to prevent some ads from showing. Therefore, using ads as the sole method to monetize your live streaming may not be the best idea.\n\n## 5. Brand deals and sponsorships \n\nBrand deals and sponsorships are another way you can earn money while streaming by engaging with businesses in a mutually beneficial arrangement. If you have a large following on streaming platforms, brands will reach out to you with offers. If they don\u2019t, you can reach out to them.\n\nWhen dealing with brands, it pays to be professional and detail-oriented. You make money when brands agree to pay you. You\u2019ll want to negotiate every part of the deal, to be 100% sure you\u2019re on the same page regarding your commitment.\n\nSome of the ways you can make money include:\n\n  * Sponsorships, where whole streams are sponsored by a brand.\n  * Banners and other types of advertisements you can display during your streams or on your channel or profile page.\n  * Sponsored content, like when a game developer pays you to play their game.\n\nYour audience is what will get a brand\u2019s attention. You should have a decent number of viewers and a clear understanding of who they are, their interests, and the types of problems they need solved. Be mindful of cutting deals that make you look like a sellout. Your audiences might not like that, and if you lose your audience, you lose the sponsors.\n\n## 6. Affiliate programs \n\nWith a membership in an affiliate program, you can earn a commission every time a shopper clicks on your affiliate link and makes a purchase. Sometimes you don\u2019t even have to post a link, because all you need is a promo or coupon code viewers can use when they shop at the place you\u2019re promoting. The link or code is provided to you once you join the affiliate program.\n\nIn the past, you had to place the affiliate link or the code in your stream description. You could also mention the coupon code once or twice during the stream. Now, you can add your affiliate link as a \u301016\u2020QR code\u2020support.restream.io\u3011 when you go live with Restream. Your audience doesn\u2019t have to go searching for the product link; they can scan with their smartphone directly from your live stream.\n\nKeep in mind that, unless the streaming platform has a deal with the affiliate program, the platform isn\u2019t profiting from your affiliate sales. So keep your content to the point and make the products or services you recommend relevant to your topic.\n\nIf you&#x27;re unsure where to start, give the Restream Referral Program a try. You can earn up to a 30% recurring commission on every subscription that comes from your link.\n\n\u301031\u2020 Learn more\u3011\n\n## 7. Create and sell your own merch \n\nMerchandise is an important revenue stream for many people who broadcast live video content. Streaming platforms have recognized this and give users plenty of advice, offering them some truly useful tools to help boost merch sales.\n\nEven with these tools, however, you\u2019ll still have plenty to figure out on your own if you decide to sell merch. What kind of products do you want to sell? T-shirts, mugs, and plush toys are all good choices. You can also sell digital products, such as music or e-books.\n\nYou\u2019ll need to think about the design, production, inventory, and shipping of your merch as well. There are a few ways you can do this, including:\n\n  * Building your own online store. Handle production, store inventory, and shipping all on your own.\n  * Overseeing the design but letting one of the platform-approved merch companies produce, store, and ship the merch for a cut of the profits.\n  * Partnering with stores that let you take advantage of special opportunities on select platforms, such as the \u301032\u2020YouTube Merch shelf\u2020support.google.com\u3011.\n\nEach of these solutions offers different profit margins and requires different levels of involvement. Whatever you choose, you can easily \u301033\u2020tie your merchandise business to your live streaming\u2020support.restream.io\u3011 by adding your product links as QR codes on your broadcast. You can even display an image of the product and the price alongside the QR code.\n\nRead more: \u301034\u2020Marketing tips for live video influencers\u3011\n\n## 8. Develop pay-per-view content \n\nProducing live content and selling tickets for it has become hugely popular. It\u2019s no longer just gaming content that gets live viewers. People with all kinds of interests and hobbies are turning to live streams to learn and exchange opinions with like-minded individuals. If you can create content that\u2019s appealing to these viewers, you can make money by selling tickets for your live stream.\n\nFirst, you need to create content that people will want to pay to watch. It should have some level of exclusivity or a way to stand out from content that is already available for free. You also have to use a platform that lets you sell tickets to live streams. Services like Streamtick let you sell admission to live broadcasts on YouTube, Facebook, or Twitter as well. With killer content and a ticketing service, you have everything you need to develop pay-per-view content.\n\n## 9. Coach/teach/offer lessons \n\nShare your knowledge through live seminars, workshops, or classes. If that sounds too academic for your taste, consider becoming someone\u2019s mentor, coach, or teacher. Instagram Live \n\nInstagram is no longer just for sharing photos with your friends. You can find on-demand and live videos from your favorite brands and influencers on the platform, too. With an \u301027\u2020expected 1.4 billion monthly active users by 2024\u2020www.statista.com\u3011 (nearly 30% of global internet users), Instagram is a good choice for video content creators. When you go live on Instagram, your followers receive a notification so they can tune in. When the live video is over, you can choose to download it and post it to your Instagram feed so anyone can watch the replay.\n\nOne thing to keep in mind with Instagram Live is that users with personal accounts can only stream from a mobile device via the Instagram app. \u301028\u2020Instagram Live Producer\u2020about.instagram.com\u3011 allows you to stream from a computer using streaming software such Restream Studio or OBS Studio but only users with Professional accounts have access to it.\n\nFeatures \n\n  * Live chat \n  * Inviting other creators to your live stream \n  * Broadcasting exclusively to paid subscribers\n  * \u201cAsk a Question\u201d sticker can make stream more engaging \n  * Live chat moderation and hiding offensive comments \n  * Monetization options \n\nPros \n\n  * Beginner-friendly \n  * Easy to use \n  * Your followers get a notification when you go live \n  * You can live stream on Stories \n  * Add fun filters and overlays to your stream \n\nCons \n\n  * Likes and comments on live video disappear when you post the replay to your feed\n\n\u00a0Learn more by reading our guide on \u301029\u2020how to go live on Instagram\u3011.\n\n### 7.
